website_summaries.verdict: No longer just a daring experiment, the G Flex 2 finally has the killer screen and top-of-the-line processor that its bold design deserves.
pros: The LG G Flex 2 sports a uniquely immersive and comfortable arched design, a sharp 1080p display, the latest Snapdragon 810 processor and a scratch-resistant coating
cons: The device's camera takes muted photos, its battery capacity is smaller than its predecessor, and performance can be slow at times

customer_reviews.title: Love the G Flex 2 H950
customer_reviews.text: Got this phone a few days ago; it's my 1st Android and so far am really enjoying it.The display is sharp & crisp and the photo quality is very good, even in low-light. The fact that it accepts a micro SD card is important to me because I take so many photos! The phone is actually Platinum Silver, though, not Black. (This model did not come in Black.) It does get very warm when charging, but not an issue so far. I took it to AT&T and they got me up & running in no time. I recommend the H950.
customer_reviews.author: Chris L.

customer_reviews.title: Great phone. Love the size and the form factor
customer_reviews.text: Great phone. Love the size and the form factor, responsiveness. Tons upon tons of ATT vaporware -- even in spite of being marketed as an "unlocked" version. Not sure if ever get to removing it or if it is even possible without rooting (which is too much hassle for me). i bought it for use with T-Mobile prepaid, it needs T-Mobile APN settings in order for data to work (google it around), but it does seem to show 4G LTE sign after that (which i guess means that it does run at LTE or at least 4G speeds after all, not just 3G). Can't see how anything else can beat it at this price.
customer_reviews.author: D.L.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty dang nice phone. But not dark enough at dimmest..
customer_reviews.text: After having it a few days, I love it. Looks and feels great, and I'm glad I could find it. I only wish the brightness could be reduced by another 50%.. That's kinda lame. But camera is decent and screen is spacious and good clarity. Overall I'd most likely buy another one as a spare.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: battery issue fixed
customer_reviews.text: An amazing phone, however, in the beginning the major issue was that without any use half of the battery was consumed within several hours, presumably due to the Android's general flaw of letting the closed applications run in the background. This was resolved by the HIBERNATION MANAGER application. It also seems that several battery charges up to 100% strengthen the battery capacity. The battery now lasts for 2 days with moderate use which is acceptable
customer_reviews.author: Marko Radulovic

customer_reviews.title: Awesome phone for price.
customer_reviews.text: Great phone! The price to performance is so good and I love how the curve fits in the pocket. The camera is also very good for the price and snaps very fast thanks to laser sensor help. The only "bad" part of the phone is it does get a little hot, but not uncomfortably hot. If you get a case for it youll never feel it again.
customer_reviews.author: Super Eagle

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone, for a year.
customer_reviews.text: I'vehad this phone for a year and 3 months. Worked great up until 3 days ago. now its stuck on a boot loop. its a great phone, but now its useless. be wary of lg cell phones; theyre known for this problem. wish there was a way to rectify this without having to buy a new phone.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos G.

customer_reviews.title: Initially worked great. Cannot say if it was unlocked as I ...
customer_reviews.text: Initially worked great. Cannot say if it was unlocked as I have ATT anyway. Purchased April 13, completely dead May 24th. No damage of any kind. Froze in a game then would never come on again. Buyer beware. Seems like a serious quality control issue on LG's part.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Good Specs, beautiful display with lacks battery life and some feature may not work as unlocked from ATT
customer_reviews.text: The phone is awesome in terms of display and its specks. But the battery died as soon as warranty period was over. Also, Internet sharing doesn't work as its unlocked from an original ATT phone.
customer_reviews.author: T.M.U

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy from this seller
customer_reviews.text: The seller sold me a used phone that lasted 6 weeks and then died..i bought a new battery and that helped. But again 2 weeks later the phone died..whatever the seller did to this phone is crazy because even a virus ridden phone should work longer than 6 weeks..do not buy any phones from this seller
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: 6 stars for an excellent product and great price!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! prestine condition and works with no issues at all with an at&t simcard. got it for my wife to replace an older lg phone and she loves it with the larger clear display and curve shape.

customer_reviews.title: this is the only cockroach that will survive the impending nuclear holocaust
customer_reviews.text: mine just got ran over by a Tahoe. screen-to-tire over the top quarter of the phone. gravel punched out the outer camera lens/protector. The back cover got scratched to hell hasn't healed itself =[ r8 0/8. Kidding, i thought the lcd was cracked but it was actually just the glass screen protector. I'm so impressed that this survived, just need a new back cover and a new camera lens for $20 and good as new. not many phones can do that

customer_reviews.text: It will get hot once in a while, but typically it runs incredibly well. I love the screen and the curve is actually nice. It's very quick and with an SD card in I have lots of memory. The preloaded apps are a bit 'meh', but Play store can help with that. Cash up front for a new phone and I'm not stuck in a contract!

customer_reviews.title: This is good product.

Its a large phone with latest Android OS. I love this phone, specially for its curvy appearance. It have a power button at the back which might be an inconvenience to few of you, but many phones in the market comes with it nowadays. Camera flash is fantastic, photos with low light and bright light are pretty much good quality. I like its front camera, its simply perfect for selfies, it comes with lot of photography options in the software. Strong, sturdy and high quality phone.

customer_reviews.title: LG G Flex 2
customer_reviews.text: Just as described! Have been using it for a week. Had trouble with AT&T updating it to Android 5.1.1, but got it updated after a week of recieving it and has been working wonderfully. Battery life isn't as great as my previous phone, but still acceptable. Performance is great, it can get a little warm, but with the update any issues regarding overheating seem to have been remedied. NOTE: You will have to contact AT&T support and also have access to an active AT&T sim to get it updated every time.

customer_reviews.title: Good phone, but comes with bloatware

The curved surface is a little odd, the only benefit of which that I could find was that if you lay the phone face down on a table or something, the screen won't get scratched. molowakane@yahoo.com

customer_reviews.title: I love double tap function to unlock the phone
customer_reviews.text: I bought it as a replacement for my S5 Galaxy. Beats the latter in every aspect. Full HD display is gorgeous. Very convenient to use. However, takes some time to get used to typing on a curved display. I love double tap function to unlock the phone. Had to add APN after inserting SIM card to start using internet. I've read online it is common problem. IMHO, the best phone for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LG g flex 2
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. It's conpatable with my Samsung smart Tv. This phone is a universal remote. For my Tv, cable, AC, I'm impressed so far 5.5 inchs loud speakers. I'm in sure about battery life.

customer_reviews.title: Heating issue
customer_reviews.text: After having the phone for a few weeks now I've noticed that the phone got around 110 degrees and the battery would die a lot quicker in this past week and it only got worse so from there I proceeded to purchase greenify pro apk and then hibernated the LG mlt process and still no luck so I am returning the device for a new one that will hopefully not burn out so fast Edit- if you are non AT&T and get in warranty service though LG they will relock the phone back to AT&T which is a huge bummer :\
customer_reviews.author: austin lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Legit Product that is Super Sleek!
customer_reviews.text: I love LG phones and was devastated when my LG G2 broke. So glad to find LG Flex 2 here for an affordable price. Phone is very sleek and easy to use. Very texter friendly because of the curve. Quick shipping, and legit product with seal on box from AT&T. Thank you!

customer_reviews.title: LG delivers again!!

And 300$ for a brand new in the box phone unlocked is too good to be true, this phone in AT&T store retails for 708$. Great phone and even greater price..

customer_reviews.title: Glitches, but over all amazing phone.
customer_reviews.text: The phone itself is amazing. Huge storage, super fast, awesome picture quality, great model. Buying refurbished is a different story. It has some glitch issues. Kinda annoying when its an emergency and I can't get to what I need. For the price it's worth the buy. Warning: this phone overheats very quickly. Do not let it sit in the sun AT ALL is will not work and potentially become dangerous.

The volume down button does not work and it comes with android 5.0.1. I was hoping maybe a software update would fix the issue, but I could not update it to 5.1.1 because i had to be on an AT&T service to recieve their update OTA. this phone can work on tmobile, however, they do not sell the lg g flex 2 so they could not update it. And the screen could have been better.... going back to the LG G Stylo.

This crap sucks, especially since the phone seems so nice to have, was kind of excited, and this disappointment sucks, I dont know if I will ever chance ordering a cell phone from 3rd party sites again.

Another minor negative is that it's rather hot, not burning, after watching videos... I don't play those 3D games with high requirement so I initially I thought it would not be an issue.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome phone- love the curved display as it is easier ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome phone- love the curved display as it is easier on the eyes and comfortable to hold. no buttons to accidentally press. Fast processor, good reception, sharp Oled screen shames LCD when it comes to black levels and contrast.
customer_reviews.author: Wyvern

customer_reviews.title: My only problem with this phone is the battery it ...
customer_reviews.text: My only problem with this phone is the battery it cause me to wonder if I bough an old or used phone. My battery saver is ON and my screen turn down to 3% yet still I have the charge the phone twice per day.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Phone died
customer_reviews.text: I had the phone for 2 months when it died never to turn on again no matter what I did. I head that's a common thing with these phones. I now have a V10 love it. My wife still has the original G flex works great.
customer_reviews.author: Ewilliams2099

customer_reviews.title: Old phone technology, not so good battery life.
customer_reviews.text: A good phone, but it is old technology for the $200 price tag. The battery life degrades pretty fast.

customer_reviews.title: Cool Phones
customer_reviews.text: I only just purchased the phone but I love my Flex I and this one is cool too. I just with the Flex II screen was as big at the Flex I. I have bad eyesight. Awesome phone, period.

customer_reviews.title: ... but not anymore this so far has been the best phone I have owned
customer_reviews.text: I was a iPhone user for years but not anymore this so far has been the best phone I have owned. It's big enough to see everything real good but not to big for the hands or my pocket it is also very fast and easy to learn how to use as mind did not come with instructions but two days later I am rocking. BV
